evidence.text: WHEREFORE, Plaintiffs pray for relief as follows: A. Declare unlawful and enter an order and an injunction compelling Defendants to undertake the activities of NEH that Defendants have unlawfully withheld and/or unreasonably delayed, 5 U.S.C. § 706(1);

extracted.value: Plaintiff: Declare unlawful and enter an order and an injunction compelling Defendants to undertake the activities of NEH that Defendants have unlawfully withheld and/or unreasonably delayed, 5 U.S.C. § 706(1)

evidence.text: B. Declare as unlawful and enter an order setting aside Defendants’ actions against the Fed/State Office and Plaintiffs as not in accordance with law, 5 U.S.C. § 706(2)(A), arbitrary and capricious, id., contrary to the Constitution, id. § 706(2)(B), in excess of statutory authority, id. § 706(2)(C),

extracted.value: Plaintiff: Declare as unlawful and enter an order setting aside Defendants’ actions against the Fed/State Office and Plaintiffs as not in accordance with law, 5 U.S.C. § 706(2)(A)-(C)

evidence.text: D. Enjoin Defendants from enforcing or giving effect to their decisions to eliminate the Fed/State Office at NEH, to shut down processing of grants to state and jurisdictional humanities councils, and to delay or refuse to spend the funds appropriated to NEH by Congress;

extracted.value: Plaintiff: Enjoin Defendants from enforcing or giving effect to their decisions to eliminate the Fed/State Office at NEH, to shut down processing of grants to state and jurisdictional humanities councils, and to delay or refuse to spend the funds appropriated to NEH by Congress

evidence.text: E. Enjoin Defendants from enforcing and giving effect to the termination notices of the Federation’s grants and its members’ grants;

extracted.value: Plaintiff: Enjoin Defendants from enforcing and giving effect to the termination notices of the Federation’s grants and its members’ grants

evidence.text: F. Enjoin Defendants to obligate and spend the full amount of funds that Congress has appropriated to the Federal State partnership at NEH without intentional delay;

extracted.value: Plaintiff: Enjoin Defendants to obligate and spend the full amount of funds that Congress has appropriated to the Federal State partnership at NEH without intentional delay

evidence.text: G. Award Plaintiffs’ reasonable costs and attorneys’ fees;

extracted.value: Plaintiff: Award Plaintiffs’ reasonable costs and attorneys’ fees

evidence.text: H. Award such other relief as this Court may deem just and proper.

extracted.value: Plaintiff: Award such other relief as this Court may deem just and proper

evidence.source_document: Brief of Amicus Curiae States Of Oregon, Maryland, Washington, Arizona, Colorado, Connecticut; Delaware, Hawai‘i, Maine, Michigan, Nevada, New Mexico, Rhode Island, Wisconsin, Vermont, And The District Of Columbia in Support of Plaintiffs’ Motion for Preliminary Injunction
evidence.text: A preliminary injunction is warranted. The Court should enter a preliminary injunction to restore the status quo while the merits of the case can be reviewed.

extracted.value: Plaintiff: Request a preliminary injunction to restore the status quo while the merits of the case are reviewed

evidence.text: Defendants request that if the Court issues injunctive relief, that relief be stayed pending the disposition of any appeal authorized by the Solicitor General of the United States or, at a minimum, administratively stayed for a period of seven days to allow the government to seek an emergency stay from the court of appeals.

extracted.value: Defendant: Request an administrative stay pending the disposition of any appeal authorized by the Solicitor General of the United States or, at a minimum, an administrative stay for a period of seven days

evidence.text: Defendants request that any injunctive relief be conditioned on a bond until this Court orders otherwise and except as otherwise expressly permitted by this Preliminary Injunction, or until such time as the parties agree in writing to amend, supersede, or terminate this Preliminary Injunction.

extracted.value: Defendant: Request that any injunctive relief be conditioned on a bond

evidence.text: Defendants request that any injunctive relief be conditioned on a bond. Defendants argue that a bond is appropriate here because any preliminary injunction would “potentially mandate that the government spend money not recoupable once distributed.”

Defendants request that any relief be stayed pending the disposition of any appeal authorized by the Solicitor General of the United States or, at a minimum, administratively stayed for a period of seven days to allow the government to seek an emergency stay from the court of appeals.
